title: Vintage Home Lighting
description: From kerosene lamps to lava lamps, how well do you remember illuminating the home?

questions.question: What type of lamp, using a glass chimney and a wick soaked in fuel, was still used in rural homes without electricity into the 1940s?
What decorative table lamp, featuring a colored wax that moved in mesmerizing blobs inside a glass cylinder, became a 1960s icon?
What type of ornate glass lampshade, featuring colorful stained glass in floral and nature patterns, was designed by Louis Comfort Tiffany?
What type of light bulb, invented by Thomas Edison in 1879, was the standard for home lighting for over a century?
What novelty item, popular in the 1970s, used a tube of fiber optic strands that glowed and changed colors?
What long, tube-shaped fluorescent light became common in kitchens and workshops during the 1950s and 1960s?
What type of ceiling light fixture, hanging with crystal or glass prisms, was a symbol of elegance in formal dining rooms?
What small, plug-in light was placed in hallway outlets to help children and adults navigate the house at night?
What type of outdoor lighting, using gas flames inside glass enclosures, was commonly seen flanking front doors in the 1950s and 1960s?
What was the popular ceramic or porcelain figure lamp that many women had on their bedroom dressers in the 1950s?
What type of switch, invented by William J. Newton in 1917, replaced the earlier turn-key switch used to turn lights on and off?
What floor lamp, popular in the 1950s, had a tall pole with multiple adjustable cone-shaped shades?
options: A pole lamp or tension pole lamp

questions.question: What GE product innovation in the 1960s replaced the standard incandescent bulb's short lifespan with a much longer-lasting alternative?
What device allowed a single lamp to provide three different levels of brightness by using a special bulb?
What colorful string of lights, originally only used at Christmas, became popular for year-round patio decorating in the 1970s?
